de.must.dataobj
Class IdManager

java.lang.Object
  de.must.dataobj.IdManager

public class IdManager
extends java.lang.Object

Central provider of primary keys. Requires a table named "Identity" as usually defined in suitable subclasses of DataObject like DoIdent. Allocates new identifiers for each entity.

See Also:
DoIdent

Method Detail

setIdTableNames

public static void setIdTableNames(java.lang.String idTableName,
                                   java.lang.String idEntityColumnName,
                                   java.lang.String idValueColumnName)
Sets the table names for internal numbers if it differs from "Identity", "Entity" and "IdentNr".

Parameters:
idTableName - the table name
idEntityColumnName - the column name
idValueColumnName - the column name containing the value

setDbProximity

public void setDbProximity(int newBbProximity)
Sets the database proximity as specified by newBbProximity. If it is ensured, that there is no other instance working on this table, you may choose not to read the current id of the entity to cache and optimize access.

Parameters:
newBbProximity - the database proximity which may be DB_PROXIMITY_ALWAYS_READ_AND_WRITE or DB_PROXIMITY_ALWAYS_WRITE

getNewIdentifier

public Identifier getNewIdentifier(java.lang.String entityName)
Returns a new identifier of the specified entity.

Parameters:
entityName - the name of the entity to retrieve the identifier
Returns:
the allocated identifier
